name: LookupResults
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Dataset
LookupResults
description:
LookupResults is a special case Array with additional values. A LookupResults object is returned from Dataset#find_all and contains the entities as well as the Keys that were deferred from the results and the Entities that were missing in the dataset.

Please be cautious when treating the QueryResults as an Array. Many common Array methods will return a new Array instance.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

tasks = datastore.find_all task_key1, task_key2, task_key3
tasks.size #=> 3
tasks.deferred #=> []
tasks.missing #=> []

examples.caption: Caution, many Array methods will return a new Array instance:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

tasks = datastore.find_all task_key1, task_key2, task_key3
tasks.size #=> 3
tasks.deferred #=> []
tasks.missing #=> []
descriptions = tasks.map { |t| t["description"] }
descriptions.size #=> 3
descriptions.deferred #=> raise NoMethodError
descriptions.missing #=> raise NoMethodError

methods.name: deferred
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Dataset
LookupResults#deferred
methods.description: Keys that were not looked up due to resource constraints.

methods.name: deferred=
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Dataset
LookupResults#deferred=
methods.description: Keys that were not looked up due to resource constraints.

methods.name: missing
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Dataset
LookupResults#missing
methods.description: Entities not found, with only the key populated.

methods.name: missing=
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Dataset
LookupResults#missing=
methods.description: Entities not found, with only the key populated.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

task_key1 = datastore.key "Task", "sampleTask1"
task_key2 = datastore.key "Task", "sampleTask2"
tasks = datastore.find_all task_key1, task_key2
if tasks.next?
  next_tasks = tasks.next
end

require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

task_key1 = datastore.key "Task", "sampleTask1"
task_key2 = datastore.key "Task", "sampleTask2"
tasks = datastore.find_all task_key1, task_key2
if tasks.next?
  next_tasks = tasks.next
end

methods.name: all
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Dataset
LookupResults#all
methods.description:
Retrieves all lookup results by repeatedly loading #next until #next? returns false. Calls the given block once for each result, which is passed as the parameter.

An Enumerator is returned if no block is given.

This method may make several API calls until all lookup results are retrieved. Be sure to use as narrow a search criteria as possible. Please use with caution.

examples.caption: Iterating each result by passing a block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

task_key1 = datastore.key "Task", "sampleTask1"
task_key2 = datastore.key "Task", "sampleTask2"
tasks = datastore.find_all task_key1, task_key2
tasks.all do |t|
  puts "Task #{t.key.id} (#cursor)"
end

examples.caption: Using the enumerator by not passing a block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

task_key1 = datastore.key "Task", "sampleTask1"
task_key2 = datastore.key "Task", "sampleTask2"
tasks = datastore.find_all task_key1, task_key2
all_keys = tasks.all.map(&:key)

examples.caption: Limit the number of API calls made:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

task_key1 = datastore.key "Task", "sampleTask1"
task_key2 = datastore.key "Task", "sampleTask2"
tasks = datastore.find_all task_key1, task_key2
tasks.all(request_limit: 10) do |t|
  puts "Task #{t.key.id} (#cursor)"
end

params.name: request_limit
params.description:
The upper limit of API requests to
make to load all lookup results. Default is no limit.

params.name: yield
params.description: The block for accessing each lookup result.
